availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Elison H. Carter (Mercer County, KY, Blacksmith)

body.p: Mercer County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Married Lucy Divine in Mercer County, Kentucky on March 10, 1853. Father of Nancy J. Carter, James E. Carter, and George W. Carter. Farmer in Mercer County in 1860. Served in the 9th Kentucky Cavalry (U.S.A.) as a private from August 1862 to August 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, District 2, p. 546.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Mercer County Marriages, Film #000191861, p. 551.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0095.
Find A Grave, E.H. Carter (August 29, 1833-April 19, 1906)," Memorial #88490230, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/88490230 (accessed August 22, 2019).
